snippet: The United States should commit to a “moon shot” for a consumer health revolution.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Frank Moss believes Americans could tap into the ingenuity that put men on the moon and created the Internet to radically cut health care costs and revitalize the economy; describes a future in which technological and engineering advances could move much of health care out of hospitals and doctors' offices and into everyday lives of Americans.

snippet: Shares of Green Mountain Coffee tumbled in after-hours trading on Wednesday as its results missed forecasts. The company defended its accounting, which had been questioned by the fund manager David Einhorn.
abstract: Shares of Green Mountain Coffee tumbled in after-hours trading on Wednesday as its results missed forecasts. The company defended its accounting, which had been questioned by the fund manager David Einhorn.

Adobe announced Wednesday that it is killing Flash for mobile devices and will instead focus its efforts on HTML5 for mobile developers. The announcement comes after several years of conflict about whether Flash works well on mobile phones. Apple ...
abstract: Adobe announced Wednesday that it is killing Flash for mobile devices and will instead focus its efforts on HTML5 for mobile developers. The announcement comes after several years of conflict about whether Flash works well on mobile phones. Apple refused to allow the software on the iPhone, iPod Touch and iPad, saying that it was too slow, and that HTML5 was the future. And many developers agreed.

headline.main: Adobe to Kill Mobile Flash, Focus on HTML5
